intro: Dictilis moluccoides, commonly known as the Moluccan spider flower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers that resemble spiders, giving it its common name. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sunlight, making it suitable for cultivation in warm climates. The flowers are often used in ornamental gardening due to their unique appearance and ability to attract pollinators.
